meanings.definition: Substances that cause red blood cells to agglutinate.
meanings.sent1: The hemagglutinins in the sample caused the red blood cells to clump together.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the effects of different hemagglutinins on red blood cells.
meanings.sent3: The hemagglutinins decided to have a party and invited all the red blood cells to join in the fun.
meanings.sent4: The hemagglutinins acted like magnets, pulling the red blood cells closer together.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a colorful model to demonstrate how hemagglutinins make red blood cells stick together.

meanings.definition: Proteins found on the surface of influenza viruses that bind to red blood cells.
meanings.sent1: The hemagglutinins on the virus helped it attach to the red blood cells.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are researching ways to target the hemagglutinins on influenza viruses.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous hemagglutinins played a game of tag with the red blood cells.
meanings.sent4: The hemagglutinins were like keys that fit perfectly into the locks of red blood cells.
meanings.sent5: The hemagglutinins were like tiny hands reaching out to grab the red blood cells.

meanings.definition: Agents that cause the clumping together of red blood cells.
meanings.sent1: The hemagglutinins in the experiment induced the red blood cells to stick together.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are investigating the mechanisms by which hemagglutinins bind red blood cells.
meanings.sent3: The hemagglutinins organized a flash mob with the red blood cells in the laboratory.
meanings.sent4: The hemagglutinins were like glue that held the red blood cells in a tight cluster.
meanings.sent5: The hemagglutinins were like traffic cops directing the red blood cells to merge into a single line.
